serial.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a story that is broadcast or printed in several separate parts on television, in a magazine etc
serial.translation[1].definitions[0].def: arranged or happening one after the other in the correct order
serial.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Keep the questions in the same serial order.
serial.translation[1].definitions[1].def: printed or broadcast in several separate parts
serial.translation[2].definitions[0].def: serial bonds etc are a set of investments which MATURE (=become due for payment) at regular intervals over a period of time
serial.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: All of the issueâ€™sserial bonds have split maturities of March 1 and Sept. 1.
The Exchange launched serial options in its sugar market yesterday.
serial.translation[2].definitions[1].def: sending data one bit (=unit) at a time over a single wire
serial.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: The serial transmission of data can be used over long distances.
serial.translation[2].definitions[2].def: appearing or happening in a fixed order, one after the other
serial.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: If you use the index facility on your PC, a serial search is not necessary.
We are considering serial publication (=printing parts of a book at regular intervals, for example in a newspaper or magazine).
